comment: "This was an investigative feature that required an unusual amount of work. Company offered just a flat rate for article, photos and travel--that is to say, it didn't' specifically pay for travel costs."

relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

comment: "Al-Jazeera has been having issues paying freelancers and interns (I was an intern as well for them)."
relationship: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

comment: "A feature for the "in depth" section. I was payed $500 minus a $15 wire transfer fee."

"I filed my assignment as requested, but when I asked where to send my invoice, I was just told I will be paid when the article is published - with no indication when this will be. It's been well over a month and no sign of published piece or my money."
paidYet: Haven't gotten it yet (as of this reporting)

comment: "Still waiting for payment. Editor said I can send invoice once the article has been published - with no indication as to when this will happen. It's been well over a month already, and I'm still waiting..."
paidYet: Haven't gotten it yet (as of this reporting)

comment: "Paid $400 day rate as a field producer to film soundbites for news package. The pay is fair but AJE takes forever (90+ days) to pay freelancers, some call it the "Al-Jazeera Savings Plan." "
